resource.chars:
[paragraph]4 Osteology<s>(1)<\s> We have seen that Ovibos Moschatus in its external 
characters approaches the Sheep and Goat more closely than any 
other Mammals, an examination of its skeleton confirms its 
ovine and caprine affinities and proves how far aloof it 
stands from Bos, Bison and especially <u>Bubalus Caffir<\u>. 
<u>Skull<\u>. The basioccipital Pl 1 bone in <u>Ovibos Moschatus<\u> <s>Pl 1<\s> Fig 1 & 2 C.D is quadrate 
in outline, with the sides roughly parallel so that the area 
included between the anterior and posterior muscular impression <s>tuberosity impression<\s> 
is either a square or an oblong with its long axes (Fig 2) at right 
angles ?parallel to the median line, the anterior impressions D also 
are oval and are not supported on a tuberosity as on the 
oxen+. In the Argali <s>Ovis Montana<\s> Big-horn (fig 4) and all the sheep <s>and<\s> 
<s>goats<\s> that have passed through my hands this quadrate 
shape has been preserved. In <u>Bos Taurus<\u>, <u>Bison Americanus<\u> 
+<s>not[?]<\s> generally perhaps in goat & sheep
